eu.cqse.check.abap

Class CrossClientDatabaseAccessCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
      • eu.cqse.check.abap.CrossClientDatabaseAccessCheck

  • @ACheck(name="Cross-client database access",
        description="<p>The addition CLIENT SPECIFIED for the Open SQL statements SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, MODIFY, DELETE and OPEN CURSOR allows access to data of an other client than the client to which the current user is logged in. Since there is no authority check performed, a user could possibly access data in a client where he has no authorization.</p><p>Note that there is no need to add a condition to the WHERE clause for restricting the selection to the current logon client (e.g. MANDT = SY-MANDT) together with CLIENT-SPECIFIED. Without CLIENT SPECIFIED this is ensured by the Open SQL statements.</p><p>See also <a href= \"http://help.sap.com/abapdocu_751/en/abenclient_dependent_scrty.htm\"/>ABAP Security Note on Cross-Client Database Access</a>.</p>",
        groupName="Security",
        languages=ABAP,
        defaultEnablement=RED)
public class CrossClientDatabaseAccessCheck
extends CheckImplementationBase
    Checks for usages of CLIENT SPECIFIED addition which can be used in Open SQL statements. The check searches for any occurrence of keyword sequence CLIENT specified since these should only occur within the Open SQL statements.
